name: iota2d
params: setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

stmt.origin: iota2df(s0, c0, c1, w0, w1, w2)
stmt.pretty: iota2df(s0, c0, c1, w0, w1, w2)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(w1, wceq(cio(s0, w2), c0)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1))
-| wi(w0, weu(s0, w2))
-| wi(wa(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wb(w2, w1))
-| wnf(s0, w0)
-| wi(w0, wnf(s0, w1))
-| wi(w0, wnfc(s0, c0))

comment: A condition that allows us to represent "the unique element such that ` ph ` " with a class expression ` A ` . (Contributed by NM, 30-Dec-2014.)
